>  I think it's easy. Start with "fewer lines of code" as a measure of
>  simplicity. When you get to the first counterexample, add the next
>  ingredient...

Thank you for your comment,

Are you talking about total lines of code or lines of code in one
place? In the example I posted (the silly one) there are obviously
fewer lines of code in the executeCommand method in the second example
but the total number of lines will likely be more (counting the total
number of lines in the project).

The example is not the best I couldn't think of a really good one,
perhaps it would make more sense if the command was executed like
this:

command.execute(this.robotController);

Or something, I have my preference but I don't know if it is the
simple one in everyones book. I think it can become more complicated
than just counting lines fo code to know what is simple but I agree
that it is a good start.
